First , using RSS Feeds will not allow you to get too much news , only limited number and you will need to get the content using a parser at the end.

You need to build your own crawler and there are multiple tools that can help you do that but you will need a dedicated server or to deploy it on a cloud service for example 

We used Abot as we aer developing in C# and it did the job. By the way you will need to write a parser for each website but be aware that you can be blocked because of excessive requests if you are crawling English websites.

Ahmed Kamal You mentioned building his own crawler and making his own spider etc.. without asking if they have the following:

1. A good budget to sustain the business.
2. A good servers that will be crawling and exporting whatever they find in the database.
3. if they already have an Algorithm to crawl and get the exact information they need or they will crawl whatever data!

Most of the good news website has APIs or RSS Feeds so if you want to make a crawler is because you want special cases website and I don't think he will need to crawl a website.

Last thing as you said he can get blocked, so why to do it the wrong way of he only can do it the correct way without getting blocked at all!

First I mentioned the need for a dedicated server or cloud service in addition to parsers to build a good crawler :)

I also mentioned the reason why I prefer them in my comment , RSS feeds are very limited and if he is going to build a large news aggregator  with different features then he shouldn't depend on RSS.  RSS is suitable for a mobile app version of a website or simple news aggregator imo.

مُحَمَّد أبو آدم
Guys, I work on that website :D
basically, it is a news aggregator that aggregates news through RSS feeds
then, crawlers run periodically on the collected news URLs to grab full articles
the full articles' text is extracted using RegEx specially tailored for every source
then, another background job runs to extract tags from the articles based on Wikipedia knowledge base which is freshly downloaded every 2 weeks
tags are then used to group similar articles under one coverage
like Mubarak's trial or Areesh explosions and so on
this is the very wide description about how the system work
